channel.title: Three questions
channel.description:
how do i make ladders work so it teles me up 1 level and over 2 spaces?
how do i make it so when i click on an abject it gives me an item?
how do i make it so u can use an item on an item to make a different item?

item.title: Three questions
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

it is a case…rofl…just because you assosciate cases with

OBJECT CLICK ONE
..what do you think makes them work? the switch. [quote="Waffles!!"]http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,204386.msg1803120/boardseen.html#new

I’m muted, so tell those people I said this(quote it if you must):

LeScape made it very clear and very simple.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Three questions
item.dc:creator: @I_Boeing_I I Boeing I
item.description:
@I_Boeing_I wrote:

LeScape ty for code but ur previous code is too confusing…let him stick with cases…

item.title: Three questions
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

go up and down commands:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("goup")) {
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("your-name")) {
heightLevel += 1;
} else {
sendMessage("FOOL!!!!!");
}
}
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("godown")) {
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("your-name")) {
heightLevel -= 1;
} else {
sendMessage("FOOL!!!!!");
}
}

boeing, telling me not to listen to him, or him to not listen to me

Read full topic

item.title: Three questions
item.dc:creator: @I_Boeing_I I Boeing I
item.description:
@I_Boeing_I wrote:

LeScape don’t listen to him…use the ::goup command or leech it from a server…then go into the room u want…get the coords and make the case tele u to those coords

Read full topic

item.title: Three questions
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

under

switch(objectid)

add

case LADDER-ID:
heightLevel += 1;
teleportToX = (absX-2);
break;

under

switch(objectid)

add

case OBJECT-ID:
addItem(ITEM-ID, AMMOUNT-TO-ADD);
break;

under

boolean checkforskilluse3

add

if (itemUsed == ITEM-1-ID && useWith == ITEM-2-ID) {
//actions here
}
if (itemUsed == ITEM-2-ID && useWith == ITEM-1-ID) {
//actions here (same as above)
}

Read full topic
